ACCESSIBLE.Definition: able to be reached or easily got

AGE-OLD.Definition: very old, or having existed for a long time

ALE.Definition: any of various types of beer, usually one that is dark and bitter

ASPIRE.Definition: to want something very much or hope to achieve something or be successful

BANQUETS.Definition: large formal meals for many people, often followed by speeches in honour of someone

BED AND BREAKFASTS.Definition: rooms to sleep in for the night and a morning meal, or private houses or small hotels offering this

BETTER OFF.Definition: to have more money than you had in the past or more money than most other people

BLACK PUDDING.Definition: a type of sausage, usually very dark in colour, that is made from pig's blood, fat, and grain

BRIDE.Definition: a woman who is about to get married or has just got married

COMFORT FOODS.Definition: the type of food that people eat when they are sad or worried, often sweet food or food that people ate as children

COMMUNION.Definition: a Christian ceremony based on Jesus' last meal with his disciples (= the twelve men who first believed in him)

COPIOUS.Definition: in large amounts, or more than enough

CORNISH.Definition: relating to Cornwall, a county in the south west of England

CURED.Definition: to treat plant or animal products by drying, smoking, salting, etc., to preserve it from decay

DECLINE.Definition: when something becomes less in amount, importance, quality, or strength

DEVIATIONS.Definition: the action of doing something that is different from the usual or common way of behaving

DODGY.Definition: likely to be dishonest or illegal; bad

DRIPPING.Definition: the fat that has come out of meat during cooking

EMERGE.Definition: to become known, especially as a result of examining something or asking questions about it

ENTHUSIASTICALLY.Definition: with a feeling of energetic interest in a particular subject or activity and an eagerness to be involved in it

FASTED.Definition: to eat no food for a period of time

FLAUNT.Definition: to show or make obvious something you are proud of in order to get admiration

GO TO HUGE LENGTHS.Definition: make large efforts to do something

GROOM.Definition: a man who is about to get married or has just got married

HIPSTER.Definition: someone who is very influenced by the most recent ideas and fashions

INHERITING.Definition: to receive money, a house, etc. from someone after they have died

INSTITUTION.Definition: a custom or tradition that has existed for a long time and is accepted as an important part of a particular society

LAVISH.Definition: large in quantity and expensive or impressive

MORTIFIED.Definition: cause (someone) to feel very embarrassed or ashamed

NATURAL SELECTION.Definition: the process that results in the continued existence of only the types of animals and plants that are best able to produce young or new plants in the conditions in which they live

OFFAL.Definition: the organs inside an animal, such as the brain, the heart, and the liver, eaten as food

PEAK.Definition: the highest, strongest, or best point, value, or level of skill

PRE-REFORMATION.Definition: before the split of the Catholic Church in Europe

PREVALENT.Definition: existing very commonly or happening often

RESERVED.Definition: to keep something for a particular purpose or group of people

SEEKING.Definition: to try to find or get something, especially something that is not a physical object

STAPLE.Definition: a basic food, or a main product or material

STRETCH TO.Definition: to manage to give or pay a particular amount, often a larger amount than you might expect

STUFFING THEIR FACES.Definition: to eat a lot of food in a short period of time

SUMPTUOUS.Definition: impressive in a way that seems expensive

TAKE FOR GRANTED.Definition: If you take situations or people for granted, you do not realize or show that you are grateful for how much you get from them

TOILING.Definition: hard work, especially work that makes you feel physically tired

ULSTER.Definition: a province of Ireland, part of which is now in Northern Ireland and part in the Republic of Ireland
